comment.text: Various other things cause Firefox to get stuck for a similarly long period. Like, opening about:config - it gets stuck showing just a text entry box and a blank space below it for a long time. Doing anything at all in about:config takes basically forever, in fact.
Filed https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1959574 .

I would rather @stransky looked at my comment first. If this goes stable and causes KDE update tests to fail intermittently on future updates it will be a big problem because we are going to start gating updates on tests soon.

Still buggy in openQA. I have actually reproduced the bug manually in a VM, too. Steps: install a clean KDE VM, mine is set up with video virtio and protocol SPICE. Run Firefox, check it works normally. Update to Firefox from u-t - either 88.0-8.fc33 or 88.0.1-fc33 - and run Firefox again. Open the URL bar and type something.

For me, it takes like 20-30 seconds before any typing I do is actually updated in the URL bar, and until that happens, the app is effectively frozen, cannot do anything else.

note, if I just type a URL blind and hit enter, it seems to break firefox out of the funk and it loads the URL. but if I just wait for what I type to actually appear, I have to wait a long time, and I don't get a response to clicking on most things while it's in that state.
Could we please push this one as f34 is already stable?

Adam, the wayland backend is enabled only when Wayland session is active. KDE does not use Wayland session on Fedora 32/33 so X11 under KDE may be used here. I suspect you see WebRender bugs as WebRender is enabled by default on KDE too. You can set gfx.webrender.force-disabled to false at about:config to force disable WebRender.

Can you please file a bug at bugzilla about the failures and attach a screenshots there?
Thanks.

is there a generic way to set `about:config` things in e.g. a policies files? it is not at all easy to teach openQA to set something in about:config, it is far easier if I can just write a configuration file. thanks.
Can we get some karma on f33 as well please? :)
Works for me.

http://camendesign.com/code/video_for_everybody/test.html
Browse to a page with a Theora format streamable video, such as any of the 'OGG' labelled files here, and attempt to play the video  

works for me

https://peach.blender.org/index.php/download/  

Not Found, the requested URL was not found on this server.

The openQA KDE browser test fails quite frequently with this update installed. If I restart it enough times it eventually gets through, but it fails a *lot*. It's failed at different points, though frequently it fails on the download icon not changing after it downloads a file (it expects a little bar to fill up, indicating the download completed).

In general, the bug here says the Wayland backend should be default "on Fedora 34", but I cannot see a difference between the specs for F34/F33/F32, and I cannot see a relevant version conditional in the spec. Did this enable the Wayland backend by default on F33 and F32? If so, that seems wrong.
OK for me on KDE (x11).

The openQA KDE browser test fails quite frequently with this update installed. If I restart it enough times it eventually gets through, but it fails a *lot*. It's failed at different points, though frequently it fails on the download icon not changing after it downloads a file (it expects a little bar to fill up, indicating the download completed).

In general, the bug here says the Wayland backend should be default "on Fedora 34", but I cannot see a difference between the specs for F34/F33/F32, and I cannot see a relevant version conditional in the spec. Did this enable the Wayland backend by default on F33 and F32? If so, that seems wrong.

bugs.title: [KDE/Plasma] Ship default Firefox Wayland backend on Fedora 34/KDE

bugzilla.short_desc: [KDE/Plasma] Ship default Firefox Wayland backend on Fedora 34/KDE

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

We may ship Firefox Wayland backend by default on KDE/Wayland. Let's track various KDE issues here:

Related links:

Pull request of the change:
https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/firefox/pull-request/26

KDE/Wayand proposal:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/WaylandByDefaultForPlasma

Upstream KDE tracker:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1609115

Given the recent state we may want to ship WebRender by default on KDE/Plasma but disable Wayland for Basic (non-accelerated) backend due to:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1685263

But that needs more testing before final decision.

We should adapt this patch to ship WebRender on KDE/Wayland too:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1680505
WebRender should be enabled by default for AMD/Intel drivers in firefox-85.0-9.fc34 build.
Small heads-up: KDE/Wayland will likely break in 86 because of https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1616894 / https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=428499

Upstream bug
https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=428499
includes committed fixes already

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 34 development cycle.
Changing version to 34.

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-5c58faca02 has a new Firefox update - firefox-87.0-7.fc34. It works for me correctly on Plasma/KDE but it needs more testing before we make it default.

For me, it takes like 20-30 seconds before any typing I do is actually updated in the URL bar, and until that happens, the app is effectively frozen, cannot do anything else.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Firefox 88.0.1 is available

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
88.0.1

Additional info:
- FTP: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/88.0.1/
- Release Notes not yet available: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/88.0.1/releasenotes/

I will add the release notes as soon as possible.

Release Notes available:

Resolved an issue caused by a recent Widevine plugin update which prevented some purchased video content from playing correctly (bug 1705138)
Fixed corruption of videos playing on Twitter or WebRTC calls on some Gen6 Intel graphics chipsets (bug 1708937)
Fixed menulists in Preferences being unreadable for users with High Contrast Mode enabled (bug 1706496)
Various stability and security fixes.

--> bug numbers are from Mozilla Bugzilla


Security Fixes:
Link: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2021-20/

- CVE-2021-29953: Universal Cross-Site Scripting
- CVE-2021-29952: Race condition in Web Render Components
Due to the security advisory: any chance to have the update?

- Fixed WebRTC indicator (mozbz#1705048).

----

- Enable Wayland backend on Plasma/KDE by default (rhbz#1922608)
